intro: Junellia selaginoides var. illapelina, commonly known as the Illapel junellia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Chile. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color, often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salinity and wind exposure. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and ecological adaptations.
